result.execSummary:
The defendant Gerri L. Simons was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).
  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

of Conviction and Order -ERP
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Gerri L. Simons in court with attorney Jeanne L. Zamzow.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that all parties have received a copy of the PSI that was filed on August 10th.  Atty Zamzow states that her and the defendant have received a copy of the PSI and have no corrections.
Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Zamzow makes sentencing arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Counts 1 & 2:  Court orders 6 years in the Wisconsin State Prison System with 2 years Incarceration and 4 years Extended Supervision with conditions; concurrent to each other and consecutive to any other sentence.
Court Costs = $268.00 on each count
DNA Sample + $250.00 Surcharge 
$400.00 costs to Marquette County Sheriff's Department
Payment of Court obligations and Supervision fees
Maintain Absolute Sobriety
AODA treatment and any follow-up treatment 
Comply and complete with any and all counseling recommended by the Agent
Eligable for Challange Incarceration Program
Eligable for Substance Abuse Program
Credit = 0 days
Bond continued to Sept. 24th with all conditions.


Atty Zamzow asks for a later report date and asks for 30 days.
Atty Hendee objects and asks for this to be forthwith.  Atty Hendee asks that the bond be applied to all costs.
Atty Zamzow asks that costs be taken out except for the $400 because it is the defendant's mother's money.
BY THE COURT:  Court grants the defendant 30 days to report.
  Report on or before September 24, 2015 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
Bond will be held until September 24th and will be taken out to pay all costs including the $400 at that time.  

  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.
Sentencing hearing at 08-19-2015 09:00 am

Defendant Gerri L. Simons in court with attorney Jeanne L. Zamzow.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee requests plea agreement.  Defendant to enter plea to Cts 1 & 2.  Count 3 will be dismissed and read-in.  Counsel will request a PSI.  Atty Zamzow agrees.
Defendant enters No Contest plea to Cts 1 & 2.  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court questions Atty Zamzow.   Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.   BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Cts 1 & 2.  Count 3 is ordered dismissed and read-in.

**Court orders a PSI and sentencing will be set.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Plea hearing at 06-18-2015 10:30 am

Defendant Gerri L. Simons in court with attorney Jeanne L. Zamzow.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Zamzow was just appointed on the case but feels the case will be resolved and asks for a Plea date 30 days out.

BY THE COURT: Set for Plea.
bond continued.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Return date at 05-21-2015 02:30 pm

Defendant Gerri L. Simons in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Gumz states that the Defendant received a copy of the information & waives it's reading.  Atty Gumz enters a Not Guilty plea.

BY THE COURT:  Not Guilty plea entered.

Atty Gumz states that he moves to withdraw on the case as he believes that there is a conflict with one of the witnesses.  Atty Gumz will have to appoint this out.  

Atty Gumz asks the court to allow him to move forward on the motion to modify the bond.
Court will allow Atty Gumz to argue the motion.  Atty Gumz states motion and asks that $1,000 = $2,000 cash bond be returned to the defendant's mother.  Atty Gumz states that the defendant is trying to get into treatment.
Atty Hendee objects to the motion and asks the court to deny the motion.

BY THE COURT:  Motion to modify the bond is denied.
Set for Return.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for April 2, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
